comment: Dr. Dail is incredibly knowledgeable. She cares about her students and provides multiple opportunities each week to connect (in an online asynchronous class). Requires some group work and challenges you to get outside your comfort zone. Lots of reading, but it is interesting content! Her use of Google Drive is way easier to navigate than D2L.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Dail was very unorganized. She was frequently not on time with getting the modules up, giving feedback to students, and the course layout was a mess. There was also multiple overlapping group projects. This course turned into a hybrid at the last minute and was sometimes all online, all on campus, and sometimes one day a week. What a mess!

Dr. Dail may be one of the most knowledgeable education professors I've ever had. She pushes us to learn both theory and practical application. However, the number of major projects, along with the time each one takes, is overwhelming. I wouldn't mind, but I got the impression she gave up and never graded them, so that's annoying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Unprofessional and insecure. Very disorganized, though she seems to know her content and probably could be a good teacher if she were more organized. Her poor organization makes her self-conscious and overly reactive to students if she is questioned. She does not like to be questioned and digs her heels in, even when she is clearly wrong.

Professor Dail is teaching this class online from her home in Tennessee.  The way she formats Google Drive  is incredibly confusing and time-consuming to dig through. She had assignments DUE over spring break but asked us not to contact her because she would be enjoying her break. Did not enjoy this class or my interactions with her.

Dr. Dail is a wonderful teacher. She is very straightforward with feedback and is almost always available in her office. The course work was not very difficult and is extremely insightful. The reading is very dense, though she spoke of changing the text for future classes. I highly recommend her for this course.

Cares deeply about students and extremely helpful. Expert in her field. Gave us a clear understanding of current issues in the field. Syllabus followed, agendas posted and expectations crystal clear. I have the pleasure to take an additional class with Dr. Dail again in my program. I learned a lot. Projects were expansive but reasonable.
Hunt down students, grade strictly, Stressed out all the time because her strict deadlines. Argues alot with students and play favors.

Excellent. Enthusiastic. She inspired me to love literature all over again via reading, Goodreads.com, and through engaging class discussion. Rigorous schedule with high expectations.Very real and helpful. Fun Professor. Be ready to stretch!

lOVE THIS INSTRUCTOR. Prepared, enthusiastic and human. Very real and shared teaching experiences with class. Funny. Schedule is rigorous and deadlines must be met with excellence. If you want to learn, take this professor.

Attend class, do the work, and read the books that are assigned. It boils down to doing the work. She cares about her students, models the work, and is engaging. The class is rigorous, but the rigor is fun as long as you like to read YAL books.

One of my favorite professors! If you show up, turn in your work on time, and make an effort to do the work you won't have a problem.  DO NOT think you can do projects/reflections the night before they are due and make a good grade on ABR's.  Do the work!  Very funny and makes you want to come to class!  Learned a lot!!

Projects can be trying and time-consuming at times, but she grades pretty easily because she can be understanding. Participate in class discussions. Dail can be moody and mean sometimes, but, she?s also understanding. Got an A. Can be slow to reply to emails. Let?s her personal life come into the classroom.

Class is very easy if you show up. very little use of textbook.  Dr Dail is hands on. I learned many things that I can take to my future classroom. sarcastic at times but I am too. expects everyone to do the work. not happy if you don't. very easy though. choose your own groups and only a few assignments for the class.

A little sarcastic at times, but over all a good professor.  She expects a lot out of you, but she gives a lot.  We didn't use the textbook a lot, and I didn't find it very helpful.  Dr. Dail's attitude for this class is learn by doing, and it worked we..  Just show up, you'll be fine.

An inappropriate, unprofessional professor. Uses inappropriate language for an academic training future Engl teachers. Share WAY too much about her personal life. Teaching strategies are either absent or overtly transparent. Tends to be arrogant and abrupt with students. That said, it is not hard to get an "A" from her if you can stand to kiss a$$.
Great Professor.  She keeps you on your toes, but the class is very informative.

Hard to rate the prof here. I earned an 'A' so all is forgiven when it comes down to it, but the class is pretty pointless to me. The prof is way into the 'young adult' novel and the course should be called 'teaching adolecent literature' rather than 'teaching literature to adolecents'. Everyone who did the work got the 'A' so can you.
I'm a C student and got an A in the class. Very fun and helpful. Comes off a little tough at first. Great Teacher. I would take her again.
Arrogant, unapproachable. Plays favorites. Didn't stick to syllabus.  Very vague with instructions and rude if you ask her questions.  Avoid her!!
A lot of work but you see the purpose at the end, and she is willing to help you whenever you need it. She is enthusiastic about her subject!
No Comments
